sentences.original: ôtê sîpîhk ayâwak nêhiyawak.
sentences.english: By yonder river some Cree were staying.

sentences.original: kîtahtawê manêsiwak cistêmâwa mîna kaskitêw mîna kaskitêw mina môsasiniyah.
sentences.text: kîtahtawê manêsiwak cistêmâwa mîna kaskitêw mîna kaskitêw mîna môsasiniya
sentences.english: Then at one time they ran short of tobacco and gunpowder and bullets.

sentences.original: nîso nâpêwak ,- ômis isiyîhkâsôw awa nâpêw : kaskitêwi-maskwah isiyîhkâsôw;
sentences.text: nîso nâpêwak ômisi isiyîhkâsôw awa nâpêw kaskitêwi-maskwa isiyîhkâsôw
sentences.english: Two men, - this was the one man's name: Black-Bear was his name;

sentences.original: kotak nâpêw kwâskwintôwân isiyîhkâsôw;
sentences.english: the other man was called Toss-Aloft;

sentences.original: êh-ociwâmihtocik, awa kwâskwintôwân osîmimâw ,-
sentences.english: they were brothers, and Toss-Aloft was the younger, --

sentences.original: êwakonik sipwêhtêwak, pahkêkinwa êh-pimiwitâcik.
sentences.english: they started out, taking along some hides.

sentences.original: pêyak pikoh misatimwa wîcêwêwak, êh-nayahtamiyit pahkêkinwa mina omaskisiniwâwa, êh-mostohtêcik.
sentences.text: pêyak piko misatimwa wîcêwêwak ê-nayahtamiyit pahkêkinwa mîna omaskisiniwâwa ê-mostohtêcik
sentences.english: They took only one horse, which carried the hides and their moccasins, and they walked.

sentences.original: êh-otihtahkik sîpiy, âsowahamwak.
sentences.english: When they came to the river, they forded it.

sentences.original: pakâsimôw awa ostêsimâw kaskitêwi-maskwah, ê-sakâpêkinât misatimwa nipîhk, osôyihk êh-takopitahk mihtos, êkotah êh-micimît kwâskwintôwân, êh-asôwahahkik.
sentences.text: pakâsimôw awa ostêsimâw kaskitêwi-maskwa ê-sakâpêkinât misatimwa nipîhk osoyihk ê-tahkopitahk mihtos êkota ê-micimît kwâskwintôwân ê-âsowahahkik
sentences.english: The older one, Black-Bear, went into the water, leading the horse by the bridle; at its tail he had tied a raft, to which Toss-Aloft held fast as they crossed.

sentences.original: pihkohôwak, êh-kapâcik.
sentences.english: They came to the other side and went ashore.

sentences.original: ê-kih-wîwahâcik otêmiwâwa, êkwah sipwêhtêwak, êh-pimohtêcik.
sentences.english: When they had re-loaded their horse, they set out again, walking.

sentences.original: nîswâw êh-nipâcik, takohtêwak waskâhikanihk, nisto-kîsikâw êh-pimohtêcik.
sentences.text: nîswâw ê-nipâcik takohtêwak wâskahikanihk nisto-kîsikâw ê-pimohtêcik
sentences.english: After two nights on the way, they reached the post, having tramped three days.

sentences.original: êkosi okimâwa wâpamêwak, êh-itâcik, cistêmâw, êkwah kaskitêw, môsw-asiniyah, êkwah cahkisêhikanah êh-pê-nâtamâhk, êh-manêsiyâhk, itêwak.
sentences.english: So then they saw the trader and told him, “Tobacco and gunpowder and bullets and flints we have come to get, for we have run short,” they told him.

sentences.original: miyêwak pahkêkinwah.
sentences.english: They gave him the hides.

sentences.original: êhag, itikwak, êh-miyikocik cistêmâwa, kontah êh-miyikocik, namoya êh-atâmâcik.
sentences.text: itikwak ê-miyikocik cistêmâwa konita ê-miyikocik namôya ê-atâmâcik
sentences.english: “Very well,” he told them, and gave them tobacco, as a present, not as part of their purchase.

sentences.original: êkosi êkwah kotakah miyikwak cistêmâwa, kaskitêw, môsw-asiniyah, cahkisêhikanah, papakiwayânasâkayah, mîna mihkwêkin, mîna kaskitêwêkin, môhkomânah, wiyamanah, wâpamonah.
sentences.text: êkosi êkwa kotaka miyikwak cistêmâwa kaskitêw môsw-asiniya cahkisêhikana papakiwayânasâkaya mîna mihkwêkin mîna kaskitêwêkin môhkomâna oyamana wâpamona
sentences.english: Then, besides, he gave them other tobacco, powder, bullets, flints, shirts, and red flannel and black broadcloth and knives, paint, and mirrors.

sentences.original: ôh ôhci opahkêkinomiwâw ohci mistahi miyikwak.
sentences.text: ôhi ohci opahkêkinomiwâw ohci mistahi miyikwak
sentences.english: For their hides he gave them many things.

sentences.original: êkotah ayâwak.
sentences.english: They stayed there.

sentences.original: nîso-tipiskâw ê-kîh-ayâcik, kî-sipwêhtêwak, êh-pê-kîwêcik, êh-nayahcikêyit otêmiwâwa pêyak.
sentences.text: nîso-tipiskâw ê-kî-ayâcik kî-sipwêhtêwak ê-pê-kîwêcik ê-nayahcikêyit otêmiwâwa pêyak
sentences.english: When they had been there over two nights, they left to come home, their one horse carrying the load.

sentences.original: nîswâw ê-kîh-nipâcik, otihtamwak itah kâ-kiw-ohcih-âsôwahahkik.
sentences.english: When they had slept twice on the way, they reached the place where they had forded on  their journey out.

sentences.original: têpâpahtamwak wîkiwâwa itah kâ-kîh-ohcih-pê-sipwêhtêcik.
sentences.english: They were in sight of their camp from which they had gone on their journey.

sentences.original: mitoni kîsopwêyiw.
sentences.english: It was very hot weather.

sentences.original: êkwah êkotah sisonê sîpîhk ayâwak, êh-âpahwâcik ôh ôtêmiwâwa, pitah êh-mîcisocik.
sentences.text: êkwa êkota sisonê sîpîhk ayâwak ê-âpahwâcik ôhi otêmiwâwa pita ê-mîcisocik
sentences.english: Then they stopped there by the bank of the river, unharnessing their horse and eating a meal before they went on.

sentences.original: êkwah ê-kîh-mîcisocik, osîhtâwak mihtos, êkotah êh-astâcik ôhi kâ-pêtâcik.
sentences.text: êkwa ê-kî-mîcisocik osîhtâwak mihtos êkota ê-astâcik ôhi kâ-pêtâcik
sentences.english: Then, when they had eaten, they built a raft, on which they placed the things they had brought with them.

sentences.original: êkwah otêmiwâwa osôyiyihk tahkopitam oma mihtos.
sentences.text: êkwa otêmiwâwa osoyiyihk tahkopitam ôma mihtos
sentences.english: Then the one tied the raft at the horse's tail.

sentences.original: hâw, êkwah, nisîm! itwêw aw ôstêsimâw.
sentences.english: “There, Brother!” said the elder.

sentences.original: êhag itwêw.
sentences.english: “All right,” said he.

sentences.original: namoya wîh-pahkopêw aw ôsîmimâw.
sentences.english: The younger could not make up his mind to go into the water.

sentences.original: piyisk otinam aw ôstêsimâw mihkwêkinos.
sentences.english: At last the elder brother took a piece of red cloth.

sentences.original: êkwah mistikosah kîskataham, êh-mâh-masinahahk.
sentences.english: Then he cut off some twigs, and marked them.

sentences.original: miyêw osîmah.
sentences.english: He gave it to his younger brother.

sentences.original: êkosi âwa kwâskwênitôwân êh-miyiht, otinam; pakâstawêham sîpîhk.
sentences.text: êkosi awa kwâskwênitôwân ê-miyiht otinam pakastawêham sîpîhk
sentences.english: When Toss-Aloft was given this, he accepted it; he threw it into the river.

sentences.original: hâw, êkwah, nisîm! itwêw kaskitêwi-maskwah, êh-pahkopêt, êh-pakâsimot.
sentences.english: “So, there now, come, Brother!” said Black-Bear, wading into the water.

sentences.original: êkwah awa osîmimâw micimîw mihtotihk.
sentences.english: Then the younger brother held on to the raft.

sentences.original: kêkâc tâwakâm apisîs êh-miyâskahk, kîtahtawê awa ostêsimâw itâmihk nipîhk kêkway kâ-miskonahk.
sentences.text: kêkâc tâwakâm apisîs ê-miyâskahk kîtahtawê awa ostêsimâw itâmihk nipîhk kêkway kâ-miskonahk
sentences.english: When he had got a bit past the middle of the stream, the elder brother suddenly felt something under the water.

sentences.original: kiskêyihtam : maci-pisiskiwah.
sentences.english: He knew what it was: an evil beast.

sentences.original: êkotah nakâsin awa misatim, êh-tawikiskawât ôh îtâmihk nipîhk k-âyâyit.
sentences.text: êkota nakâsin awa misatim ê-tâwikiskawât ôhi itâmihk nipîhk kâ-ayâyit
sentences.english: There the horse stood still, as it struck with its foot the creature that was under the water.

sentences.original: namoya wâpamêwak;
sentences.english: They could not see it;

sentences.original: piyisk awa nâpêw êkotêh ispayihôw, ositihk ohci ê-wîh-kakwê-miskawât ôh îtâmihk k-âyâyit.
sentences.text: piyisk awa nâpêw êkotê ispayihôw ositihk ohci ê-wî-kakwê-miskawât ôhi itâmihk kâ-ayâyit
sentences.english: at last that man bent over that way, trying to find with his foot the creature that was below.

sentences.original: êh-miskoskawât, êkotah nakêstiw, êh-ocipitât ôh ôtêmah.
sentences.text: ê-miskoskawât êkota nakêstiw ê-ocipitât ôhi otêma
sentences.english: When he had found it with his foot, he stood still and drew the horse toward him.

sentences.original: pihkohêw.
sentences.english: He got the horse to come.

sentences.original: êkos âti-sipwêhtêw.
sentences.english: So then he started to go on.

sentences.original: aw ôsîmimâw nâway k-âyât, êh-miskoskawât, sêkisiw.
sentences.text: awa osîmimâw nâway kâ-ayâ-t ê-miskoskawât sêkisiw
sentences.english: When the younger brother, who was in the rear, felt the creature with his foot, he grew frightened.

sentences.original: ômis îtwêw : nistêsê, nistêsê! itwêw.
sentences.english: “Brother, Brother!” he cried.

sentences.original: êkâ wiyah nântaw itwê! itwêw aw ôstêsimâw;
sentences.english: “Do not say a word!” said the elder;

sentences.original: kinâpêwin, nisîm! itêw.
sentences.english: “You are a man, Brother!” he told him.

sentences.original: êkosi kêkâc êh-kapâcik, kîtahtawê êkotê ispayiwak, tâpiskôc êh-ocipitikocik ôhih kâ-kîh-miskoskawâcik.
sentences.text: êkosi kêkâc ê-kapâcik kîtahtawê êkotê ispayiwak tâpiskôc ê-ocipitikocik ôhi kâ-kî-miskoskawâcik
sentences.english: But then, when they had almost reached the shore, suddenly they moved in the other direction, exactly as if they were  being pulled back by the creature they had stepped upon.

sentences.original: âsay mîna aw ôsîmimâw, nistêsê, nistêsê! itwêw.
sentences.english: Again the younger brother cried, “Brother, Brother!”

sentences.original: êkâ nânitaw itwê, nisîm! itwêw aw ôstêsimâw, êhci pikô êh-yâhyânahk aw ostêsimâw.
sentences.text: itwêw awa ostêsimâw âhci piko ê-yâhyânahk awa ostêsimâw
sentences.english: “Do not say a word, Brother!” said the older one, swimming against the pull.

sentences.original: âsay mîna kiskêyihtam êh-asêpayit.
sentences.english: Again he perceived that he was moving backwards.

sentences.original: âsê mîna osîma ma-mawimoyiwa, nistêsê, nistêsê! êh-itwêt.
sentences.english: Again his brother entreated, crying, “Brother, Brother!”

sentences.original: êkwah âpasâpiw.
sentences.english: Then he looked behind him.

sentences.original: êh-kitâpamât osîma, kâ-wâpamât misi-kinêpikwah êh-môskipêyit.
sentences.english: When he looked at his brother, he saw a Great Serpent emerge from the water.

sentences.original: wîstah sêkisiw.
sentences.english: He too was frightened.

sentences.original: ômis îtwêw aw ôstêsimâw : hahâw, nimosô, piyêsiw, kikîh-itwân; êyôkô ohci nama kêkway k-ôh-kostamân, itwêw aw ôstêsimâw.
sentences.text: ômisi itwêw awa ostêsimâw itwêw awa ostêsimâw
sentences.english: Thus spoke the elder brother: “Now then, 0 my grandfather, Thunderer, 'If by anything you should be frightened, from close by I shall be looking at you,' you said; that is why I fear nothing,” said the elder brother.

sentences.original: kiyipah âsay pêhtawêw piyêsiwa, êh-kitôyit.
sentences.english: In a moment he heard a Thunderer roaring.

sentences.original: hâtah êh-âhkamêyimot êh-yâhyânahk, piyisk pahpahkipêstâyiw, ê-wîh-kimiwaniyik; mâka tahkih kitoyiwa piyêsiwa.
sentences.text: âta ê-âhkamêyimot ê-yâhyânahk piyisk pahpahkipêstâyiw ê-wî-kimiwaniyik mâka tahki kitoyiwa piyêsiwa
sentences.english: When nevertheless he swam with all his might, soon there fell scattered drops of a coming rain; meanwhile unceasingly roared the Thunderer.

sentences.original: kîtahtawê mistahi pêhtâkosiyiwa.
sentences.english: Presently he made a great noise.

sentences.original: tâpiskôc êh-matwêwêyik itihtam; aspin êkwah nama kiskêyihtam.
sentences.text: tâpiskôc ê-matwêwêyik itihtam aspin êkwa nama kiskêyihtam
sentences.english: The man heard it like the report of a cannon; that was the last he knew.

sentences.original: kîtahtawê iyikohk ê-kiskêyihtahk, pôtih pâhkwahcâhk kâ-pimisihk aw ôstêsimâw.
sentences.text: kîtahtawê iyikohk ê-kiskêyihtahk pôti pâhkwahcâhk kâ-pimisihk awa ostêsimâw
sentences.english: After a time, when he came to his senses, there lay that elder brother on the dry land.

sentences.original: êkwah êh-nanâtawâpit, namoya wâpamêw osîma, mîna otêma, mîn ôhi kâ-kîh-wâpamât misi-kinêpikwah.
sentences.text: êkwa ê-nanâtawâpit namôya wâpamêw osîma mîna otêma mîna ôhi kâ-kî-wâpamât misi-kinêpikwa
sentences.english: When he looked about him, he did not see his brother, or the horse, or the Great Serpent which he had seen.

sentences.original: mâskôc môwik nisîm, itêyihtam.
sentences.english: “Perhaps it has eaten my brother,” he thought.

sentences.original: êh-pasikôt, êh-âmaciwêt, kâ-wâpamât osîma, tahkohcâyihk ê-papâmitâcimoyit osîma.
sentences.text: ê-pasikôt ê-âmaciwêt kâ-wâpamât osîma tahkohcâyihk ê-papâmitâcimoyit osîma
sentences.english: When he rose to his feet and walked up the slope, there he saw his brother, crawling about at the top of the bluff.

sentences.original: êkotê kâ-wâpamât otêma êh-ma-mîcisoyit, kêyâpic osôyiyihk êh-tahkopitêyik ômah mihtos.
sentences.text: êkotê kâ-wâpamât otêma ê-ma-mîcisoyit kêyâpic osoyiyihk ê-tahkopitêyik ôma mihtos
sentences.english: And there he saw his horse grazing, with the raft still tied at its tail.

sentences.original: hay hay! itwêw; pimâtisiw nisîm! êh-itwêt.
sentences.english: “Splendid!” he cried; “My brother is alive!”

sentences.original: êh-otihtât, pasikôyiwah osîma.
sentences.english: When he came up to him, his brother arose.

sentences.original: êh-at-îtohtêcik otêmiwâwa, êh-otihtâcik, âpihkonamwak ôma osôyiyihk kâ-tahkopitêyik.
sentences.text: ê-ati-itohtêcik otêmiwâwa ê-otihtâcik âpihkonamwak ôma osoyiyihk kâ-tahkopitêyik
sentences.english: Then they went on to where their horse was, and, when they got to it, untied the thing that was tied to its tail.

sentences.original: êkwah ôhi kâ-kîh-pôsihtâcik êwakoni êh-wâpahtahkik, nama kêkway wanihtâwak.
sentences.text: êkwa ôhi kâ-kî-pôsihtâcik êwakoni ê-wâpahtahkik nama kêkway wanihtâwak
sentences.english: When they looked at the things that they had loaded on there, they missed nothing.

sentences.original: êkosi namoya kiskêyihtam kîkwaya êh-kapâwêpinikocik; ayisk namoya wâpamêw awiya kâ-tôtâkocik.
sentences.text: êkosi namôya kiskêyihtam kîkwaya ê-kapâwêpinikocik ayisk namôya wâpamêw awiya kâ-tôtâkocik
sentences.english: And so he did not know by what sort of being they had been thrown ashore; for he had not seen anyone do that to them.

sentences.original: êkosi wawêyîwak, ê-wiyahpitâcik otêmiwâwa, êh-nayahtahâcik ôhi kâ-pêtâcik, êh-ati-kîwêcik.
sentences.text: êkosi wawêyîwak ê-wiyahpitâcik otêmiwâwa ê-nayahtahâcik ôhi kâ-pêtâcik ê-ati-kîwêcik
sentences.english: So they made ready, harnessing their horse and loading it with the things they had brought, and went on towards home.

sentences.original: ksiwâk êh-ihtâcik, ômis îtwêw aw ôstêsimâw : nisîm, niya nik-âcimon ôma k-êsi-wâpahtamahk, k-êsi-kiskêyihtamahk tânisi êy-ispayiyahk, itwêw aw ôstêsimâw;
sentences.text: kisiwâk ê-ihtâcik ômisi itwêw awa ostêsimâw itwêw awa ostêsimâw
sentences.english: When they were near, the elder brother said: “Brother, I shall tell of what we have seen, of the experience we have gone through,” said the elder one;

sentences.original: kika-ntôhtawin, itah kiyâskiyâni ayîwâkês wîh-itâcimoyânih, itwêw.
sentences.english: “You will hear me, if at any point I try to lie or exaggerate,” said he.

sentences.original: âhag, itwêw ôw osîmimâw.
sentences.english: “Very well,” said the younger.

sentences.original: piyisk takohtêwak wîkiwâhk.
sentences.english: At last they came to their camp.

sentences.original: êkwah ê-kîh-pîhtokêcik, êkwah nitomêw nâpêwa, êh-pîhtokêt, êh-mâh-miyât cistêmêwa, hâw, kîstawâw ta-pîhtwâyêk! êh-itât.
sentences.text: êkwa ê-kî-pîhtokêcik êkwa nitomêw nâpêwa ê-pîhtokêt ê-mâh-miyât cistêmâwa ê-itât
sentences.english: Then when they had entered, he called the men, and as they entered, gave each of them tobacco, saying to them “There, that you too smoke!”

sentences.original: hâ!
sentences.english: “Ho!”

sentences.original: nanâskomoyiwa.
sentences.english: They thanked him.

sentences.original: pêskis ê-wîh-âcimostâtakok tânisi ispayiyâhk awa nisîm ôtah sîpîhk, itwêw.
sentences.english: It is because at the same time I wish to tell you how my brother here and I fared by this river,” he said.

sentences.original: hâhag, itik ôh ayîsiyiniwah.
sentences.english: “Very well,” said those people to him.

sentences.original: êkwah âcimôw ôma êkâh kâ-wîh-pahkopêyit osîma, piyisk anihi kâ-miyât osîma; êyôkô âcimôw.
sentences.text: êkwa âcimôw ôma êkâ kâ-wî-pahkopêyit osîma piyisk anihi kâ-miyât osîma êwako âcimôw
sentences.english: Then he told how his brother had been unwilling to wade in and how he had at last given his brother those objects; he told of that.

sentences.original: piyisk kâ-pahkopêcik, tânisi k-êsi-kiskêyihtahkik, êwakô âcimôw, piyisk êkâ êh-kiskêyihtahk, pâhkwahcâhk êh-ayâcik.
sentences.text: piyisk kâ-pahkopêcik tânisi kâ-isi-kiskêyihtahkik êwako âcimôw piyisk êkâ ê-kiskêyihtahk pâhkwahcâhk ê-ayâcik
sentences.english: He told of what they had perceived when they finally went into the water, and of how in the end he had lost consciousness, and how they had got to the dry land.

sentences.original: itwêwak ôk ayîsiyiniwak, niwâpahtênân mistah êkotê êh-mâyi-kîsikâk, mîna mistah êh-kitocik êkotê piyêsiwak, itwêwak.
sentences.english: Said those people, “We saw that there was a great storm over yonder, and that the Thunderers made a great noise there,” said they.

sentences.original: mâskôc êwakonik êh-kapâwêpinikoyâhkok, itwêw awa ostêsimâw.
sentences.english: “No doubt it was they who threw us ashore,” said the elder brother.

sentences.original: êkosi âwako âcimôwin êh-iskwâk.
sentences.english: So ends this story.

sentences.original: nimosom awa kaskitêwi-maskwa.
sentences.english: This Black-Bear was my grandfather.
